content: This report provides an overview of actions taken by the Administration and Congress for FY2014 appropriations for Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies (CJS) accounts, as well as FY2013 appropriations for CJS agencies and bureaus. The FY2013 post-sequestration amounts were provided by various departments and agencies, while the FY2014 requested and enacted appropriations were detailed in specific reports. For FY2014, the Administration requested $63.310 billion for agencies funded under the CJS bill. The House Committee on Appropriations approved $58.601 billion for these agencies, with allocations for the Department of Commerce, Department of Justice, science agencies, and related agencies. The Senate Committee on Appropriations approved $63.586 billion for the Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2014. President Obama signed the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2014 into law, providing a total of $61.623 billion for CJS. The Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013 (P.L. 113-6) allocated $57.936 billion for the Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies, with specific amounts designated for different departments and agencies. Section 3001 of the act included rescissions of FY2013 budget authority, with discretionary non-security accounts facing a 1.877% rescission and discretionary security accounts facing a 0.1% rescission. Section 3004 of the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013 aimed to eliminate any excess budget authority beyond FY2013 discretionary spending limits. It included two separate across-the-board rescissions for non-security and security budget authority, both set at 0%. Rescissions were applied proportionately to discretionary accounts and items of budget authority. The Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013 included across-the-board rescissions for non-security and security budget authority, set at 0%. Additional rescissions were calculated by OMB post-enactment. Only specific accounts were subject to the rescissions. The appropriations provided do not reflect reductions from sequestration ordered by President Obama in 2013. The Disaster Relief Appropriations Act of 2013 (P.L. 113-2) allocated $363.3 million in supplemental appropriations for various CJS agencies. This included funding for NOAA, FBI, DEA, ATF, Bureau of Prisons, NASA, and Legal Services Corporation.
